transportAdvice: Tunis has a light metro (tram-style) network and an extensive bus system that connects most tourist areas, though services can be crowded and infrequent. Taxis are widely available and affordable, and the historic medina is best explored on foot.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy with mild days; a light jacket is essential.
Still cool with some rain showers, but sunny spells become more frequent.
Warming up with a mix of sun and occasional showers; pleasant for sightseeing.
Mild and mostly sunny, making it one of the more comfortable months to visit.
Warm and dry with long sunny days; ideal conditions for outdoor exploration.
Hot and dry with very little rain; early mornings are the best time for sightseeing.
Peak summer heat with intense sun; coastal breezes offer some relief.
The hottest month of the year; shade and hydration are essential during midday.
Still warm but beginning to cool slightly; a very pleasant time to visit.
Comfortable temperatures return with occasional autumn showers.
Noticeably cooler with more frequent rain; a quieter period for tourism.
Cool and wet with short days; a warm layer and rain jacket are advisable.
